thread.title: Security guard slain during liquor store robbery
thread.title_full: Security guard slain during liquor store robbery - FOX 8 WVUE New Orleans News, Weather, Sports, Social

author: KSLA Staff
title: Security guard slain during liquor store robbery
text:
SHREVEPORT, LA (KSLA) - A security guard is dead as a result of a shooting during a liquor store holdup Friday night in Shreveport's Cedar Grove neighborhood, authorities say.
The call summoning police to the Thrifty Liquor store in the 8400 block of Linwood Avenue came in just after 10 p.m., Caddo 911 dispatch records show.
A male wearing all black was in the process of robbing the store when the guard was shot, authorities say. The wounded guard was taken to University Health, where he was pronounced dead.
In addition to the guard, several store employees and customers were in the store at the time of the robbery and shooting. No one else was wounded.
Shreveport police detectives believe only one shot was fired. They are interviewing the employees and customers and plan to review the store's surveillance video.
It's still early in the investigation, so police have yet to release the identity of the guard and further details about what happened.
There still are about 17 police units on the scene.
